text: The oracle of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A jealous and avenging God is the Lord;
The Lord is avenging and wrathful.
The Lord takes vengeance on His adversaries,
And He reserves wrath for His enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is slow to anger and great in power,
And the Lord will by no means leave the guilty unpunished.
In whirlwind and storm is His way,
And clouds are the dust beneath His feet.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Mountains quake because of Him
And the hills dissolve;
Indeed the earth is upheaved by His presence,
The world and all the inhabitants in it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who can stand before His indignation?
Who can endure the burning of His anger?
His wrath is poured out like fire
And the rocks are broken up by Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is good,
A stronghold in the day of trouble,
And He knows those who take refuge in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But with an overflowing flood
He will make a complete end of its site,
And will pursue His enemies into darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whatever you devise against the Lord,
He will make a complete end of it.
Distress will not rise up twice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like tangled thorns,
And like those who are drunken with their drink,
They are consumed
As stubble completely withered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
From you has gone forth
One who plotted evil against the Lord,
A wicked counselor.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord,
“Though they are at full strength and likewise many,
Even so, they will be cut off and pass away.
Though I have afflicted you,
I will afflict you no longer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“So now, I will break his yoke bar from upon you,
And I will tear off your shackles.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has issued a command concerning you:
“Your name will no longer be perpetuated.
I will cut off idol and image
From the house of your gods.
I will prepare your grave,
For you are contemptible.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the Lord will restore the splendor of Jacob
Like the splendor of Israel,
Even though devastators have devastated them
And destroyed their vine branches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The shields of his mighty men are colored red,
The warriors are dressed in scarlet,
The chariots are enveloped in flashing steel
When he is prepared to march,
And the cypress spears are brandished.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The chariots race madly in the streets,
They rush wildly in the squares,
Their appearance is like torches,
They dash to and fro like lightning flashes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He remembers his nobles;
They stumble in their march,
They hurry to her wall,
And the mantelet is set up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The gates of the rivers are opened
And the palace is dissolved.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is fixed:
She is stripped, she is carried away,
And her handmaids are moaning like the sound of doves,
Beating on their breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though Nineveh was like a pool of water throughout her days,
Now they are fleeing;
“Stop, stop,”
But no one turns back.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Plunder the silver!
Plunder the gold!
For there is no limit to the treasure—
Wealth from every kind of desirable object.
speaker: Narrator

text:
She is emptied! Yes, she is desolate and waste!
Hearts are melting and knees knocking!
Also anguish is in the whole body
And all their faces are grown pale!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Where is the den of the lions
And the feeding place of the young lions,
Where the lion, lioness and lion’s cub prowled,
With nothing to disturb them?
speaker: Narrator

text:
The lion tore enough for his cubs,
Killed enough for his lionesses,
And filled his lairs with prey
And his dens with torn flesh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Behold, I am against you,” declares the Lord of hosts. “I will burn up her chariots in smoke, a sword will devour your young lions; I will cut off your prey from the land, and no longer will the voice of your messengers be heard.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to the bloody city, completely full of lies and pillage;
Her prey never departs.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The noise of the whip,
The noise of the rattling of the wheel,
Galloping horses
And bounding chariots!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Horsemen charging,
Swords flashing, spears gleaming,
Many slain, a mass of corpses,
And countless dead bodies—
They stumble over the dead bodies!
speaker: Narrator

text:
All because of the many harlotries of the harlot,
The charming one, the mistress of sorceries,
Who sells nations by her harlotries
And families by her sorceries.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, I am against you,” declares the Lord of hosts;
“And I will lift up your skirts over your face,
And show to the nations your nakedness
And to the kingdoms your disgrace.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will throw filth on you
And make you vile,
And set you up as a spectacle.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“And it will come about that all who see you
Will shrink from you and say,
‘Nineveh is devastated!
Who will grieve for her?’
Where will I seek comforters for you?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Are you better than No-amon,
Which was situated by the waters of the Nile,
With water surrounding her,
Whose rampart was the sea,
Whose wall consisted of the sea?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Ethiopia was her might,
And Egypt too, without limits.
Put and Lubim were among her helpers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You too will become drunk,
You will be hidden.
You too will search for a refuge from the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your fortifications are fig trees with ripe fruit—
When shaken, they fall into the eater’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Draw for yourself water for the siege!
Strengthen your fortifications!
Go into the clay and tread the mortar!
Take hold of the brick mold!
speaker: Narrator

text:
There fire will consume you,
The sword will cut you down;
It will consume you as the locust does.
Multiply yourself like the creeping locust,
Multiply yourself like the swarming locust.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have increased your traders more than the stars of heaven—
The creeping locust strips and flies away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your guardsmen are like the swarming locust.
Your marshals are like hordes of grasshoppers
Settling in the stone walls on a cold day.
The sun rises and they flee,
And the place where they are is not known.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your shepherds are sleeping, O king of Assyria;
Your nobles are lying down.
Your people are scattered on the mountains
And there is no one to regather them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
There is no relief for your breakdown,
Your wound is incurable.
All who hear about you
Will clap their hands over you,
For on whom has not your evil passed continually?
speaker: Narrator
